name: MY EYES WENT DARK
blurb: A father loses his family in a freak plane crash and goes on to murder the air traffic controller he holds responsible.

name: Get. That. Snitch. - The World's Most Dangerous Play
blurb: A stylishly sinister story about blood, guns, and raw ambition. You can help Great Minds bring the world's most dangerous play to life!

name: MAX & ELSA: NO MUSIC. NO CHILDREN.
blurb: A subversive parody about the two people for whom the hills were NOT alive with THE SOUND OF MUSIC.

name: the dreamer examines his pillow
blurb: The Attic Theater Company presents John Patrick Shanley's THE DREAMER EXAMINES HIS PILLOW, the first official revival since 1986

name: Grassroots Shakespeare Company • Arizona
blurb: A pop-up outdoor theatre company bringing accessible Shakespeare to parks and other locations in the greater Phoenix area!

name: One Funny Mother: I'm Not Crazy!!
blurb: A hilarious comedy show about motherhood...through stories, videos and stand-up you'll realize YOU’RE NOT CRAZY, motherhood is!

name: Visión Latino Theatre Company
blurb: Visión Latino Theatre Company was founded by three young latino professionals sharing the stories of everyday latinos.

name: Victory by Madicken Malm
blurb: We have a brand new play. We urgently need your help to fund our production, which opens at Theatre503 on August 18th.

name: Devastated No Matter What
blurb: A Festival Backed Production of a Full-Length Play.

name: Corners Grove
blurb: Corners Grove is a coming-of-age play about leaving home, gender identity and the death of Whitney Houston; will benefit Win NYC.

name: Fat Pig, The Play!
blurb: Bringing one of Neil LaBute's incredibly witty and viciously honest plays, about body image and the effect it has on us, to life!

name: Alix in Wundergarten
blurb: A dark theatrical comedy about four actors recording a warped radio version of Lewis Carroll's 'Alice's Adventures in Wonderland'.

name: Roughly Speaking: Voices from The Soup Kitchen
blurb: Five playwrights volunteer at New York's largest soup kitchen and develop a play around the people they meet.

name: Enso Theatre Ensemble's "Pride & Prejudice"
blurb: Perception. Impulse. Love. The Enso Theatre Ensemble presents Jane Austen's "Pride & Prejudice" like you've never seen it before.

name: Season Scandinavia
blurb: Empty Deck presents the most exciting unknown contemporary Scandinavian plays in co-production with The Other Room Theatre, Cardiff.

name: Eyes Closed - The First In-Dream Theater Experience
blurb: Eyes Closed is a collaborative play and docudrama about New Yorkers and their dreams.

name: Good People by David Lindsay-Abaire at Waterfront Playhouse
blurb: Bringing David Lindsay-Abaire's award-winning story of our times to the East Bay.

name: 'Gretel and Hansel' - A Children's Theatre Production
blurb: 'Gretel and Hansel' by Sam Leeves - an inclusive, multi-sensory theatre production for children aged seven to eleven and their families

name: COMPASS PLAYERS
blurb: *** TO MAKE DONATIONS IN THE FUTURE                                   GO TO OUR WEBSITE: www.compassplayers.com ***

name: Good People at The Hudson Guild Theatre
blurb: LOOKING FOR GOOD PEOPLE to help fund our production of "Good People" with Kia Hellman & Shayne Anderson, directed by Christine Dunford.

name: Quirky Bird Theatre's Young Actors on Tour
blurb: Creating outstanding performance experiences with young actors from all economic backgrounds. Making great theatre accessible to all!

name: Foresight
blurb: New writing • Twisty-turny magical realist retro sci-fi • Human lives • Storytelling • The slope our society slips down...

name: Shakespeare Orange County's HAMLET: Match This!
blurb: SOC produces affordable and accessible theatre in the heart of Orange County, CA, and we need your help to match a $5,000 grant!

name: The Fall - an epic theatrical adaptation
blurb: The theatrical adaptation of the epic film ‘THE FALL’ for the stage, combining theatre, live music, animation and expansive projection.

name: Wake Up Call @ IRT Theater
blurb: Wake Up Call is a comedic play about a group of hotel employees working on Christmas Eve.

name: THE FALL - A New Play at FringeNYC!
blurb: An ensemble-driven play inspired by real-life accounts about six young women who lost their fathers on 9/11. August 2016 at FringeNYC!

name: right left with heels: US Premiere at City Garage
blurb: The US premiere of the controversial new Polish play the authorities don't want you to see, staged by an award-winning director.

name: Fool for Love by Sam Shepard
blurb: McQueen & Company is striving to  bring Sam Shepard's fan favorite Fool for Love to life in all its relentless glory for 3 wks in June

name: Threads by David Lane at The Hope Theatre - 11-29 April
blurb: Time Zone Theatre & Arteria Theatre present this emotional thriller about Love, Loss and what happens when life goes on, but you can't.

name: Callan's MFA Thesis Play: you do not look
blurb: A workshop production of my play 'you do not look' at Signature's Ford Studio, presented by Columbia University.

name: The Sleeper: A New Play by Anima Theatre Company
blurb: A play exploring the immigration crisis, prejudice and identity using the real stories of Syrian refugees.

name: Flat Tire Productions presents "LOVE BITES"
blurb: Explore the mysteries of romance & the search for true love in five one-act American plays from our West Indian community theater group

name: Repetitive Beats: A new play premiering at Vault Festival
blurb: Get Repetitive Beats to Vaults! A high octane play set in Oxford  during one of the most influential & hedonistic movements in music.

name: Princess Suffragette: a new play for VAULT Festival 2017
blurb: An inventive (re)telling of Princess Sophia Duleep Singh’s journey, from an aristocratic upbringing to a life of political activism.

name: 64 Squares
blurb: 64 Squares is an autobiographical one-man exploration of the internal chess game played to reconcile relationships.

name: Radio
blurb: Sunscreen Productions begin their first UK tour with 'Radio', an explosive black comedy about youth, lies, and one truant radio

name: 'Window' By Ron Elisha
blurb: Another Soup presents this honest portrayal of a young married couple and what happens when things go wrong.

name: Honey Dipped Apocalypse Girls: An Independent Play in NYC
blurb: An all-female written and produced independent play. April 12-15, Kraine Theater, NYC.

name: Beirut directed by Robin Lefevre at Park Theatre
blurb: I am producing 'Beirut' by Alan Bowne directed by Robin Lefevre at Park Theatre in Finsbury Park from 12th June - 7th July 2018.

name: Lilies
blurb: A dramatic staging of the play Lilies by Michel Marc Bouchard, translation by Linda Gaboriau. Directed by Ned Record.

name: Solo Performance Show: "My Calico Soul"
blurb: Fair Oaks Productions is proud to present a world premiere play about Acceptance, Identity and Strength.

name: CONFIDENCE (and The Speech) - A play with history in One Act
blurb: A not-exactly true perspective of a very true story. Help us get this compelling new play its first production.

name: Lilac Co - Plays for Adults
blurb: Support two new productions by the experimental theater company

name: The Knot
blurb: Bring new writing play 'The Knot' to The Old Red Lion Theatre!

name: Giving up Marty
blurb:
'Don't you want to find your birth mother?'

'It’s history, what’s the point of raking up the past?

But what if the past comes to you?

name: Blood Orange
blurb: BLOOD ORANGE is a new one woman play, exploring themes of love, loss and childhood trauma through the eyes of a junior doctor in A&E

name: Peaceful Disease R&D
blurb: Research and Development for Emma Bentley's new play "Peaceful Disease"

name: The Formidable Lizzie Boone
blurb: A one-woman show exploring the intricacies of humanity through a woman who loves vodka with lemonade, burlesque and a cat named Lionel.

name: Godless: A One-Act Play
blurb: A One-Act Play that discusses humankind's perception of a higher power, and how each of us defines faith.

name: Artorigus
blurb: The Downfall of a King

name: Picture Perfect
blurb: The extraordinary untold story of Hollywood's first female photojournalist who arrived in 1926 and exposed its #MeToo truth

blurb: Oceans apart yet connected as we weave a series of stories displaying common themes from all over the world.
